title: Surpassing Expectations, Rare Patek Philippe Wristwatch Sells for $93,825 to Benefit Charity
text:
Patek Philippe 18K gold dual time zone wristwatch Courtesy of Bonhams

Text size

A very rare Patek Philippe wristwatch, one of the 15 watches and wristwatches from the collection of Nicole and William M. Keck II, fetched $93,825 at a Bonhams auction in New York this week.

Designed in the late 1950s, the Patek Philippe Ref. 2597 dual time zone wristwatch was aimed at sophisticated international air travelers. It features an independently adjustable hour hand designed by the renowned Swiss artisan Louis Cottier.

The piece offered from the Kecks collection was made in 1960 and had the signature of Gübelin—the watch manufacturer—on the dial, which adds to its rarity, Bonhams said.
description: The timepiece was offered from the collection of oil heir William M. Keck II at Bonhams
